column4: just upgraded to 10.04, but desktop effects are disabled and I can't turn them on via System > Appearance anymore. Thoughts on troubleshooting?
andrew___: yeah, desktop effects is compiz, isn't it? can't enable it anymore
Can you pastebin the output of 'compiz --replace &' from your terminal to pastebin.org ?
Your drivers are screwed up. Can you pastebin your X log? (/var/log/Xorg.0.log file)
You have the nvidia driver installed but your chipset is reported as Intel
weird. my chipset is definitely intel and not nvidia. pointers on how to fix it?
I have someone who just fixed this same issue in #compiz
First, review the output of 'dpkg -l|grep nvidia'  and .. pastebin it
Ok, remove all the packages that have 'ii' next to them (which means they're currently installed)
After removing those packages, hopefully it will work after a reboot
But it's not a bad idea to reinstall libgl1-mesa-glx and -dri
ok, cool, thanks, I'll do that too
uninstalled those nvidia packages, restarted my xserver, and I was able to re-enable compiz -- thanks!
